newsitem.title: LITHUANIA: SECURITIES COMMISSION LICENCES HANSA INVESTMENTS.
newsitem.headline: SECURITIES COMMISSION LICENCES HANSA INVESTMENTS.

text.p: Lithuania's securities commission said on Friday that it issued a licence to Hansa Investments investment managment and consulting company to operate in the country's market.
"Hansa Investment was issued a lisence to carry out investment managment and consulting activities in Lithuania," Rasa Garnevichiene of the securities commission told Reuters.
Hansa Investment is the first foreign company of its kind permitted to function in Lithuania, Garnevichiene added.
The securities commission had rejected its application on two previous occasions on the grounds that its by-laws conflicted with local requirements.
Hansa Investments is a subsidiary of Hansa Group, which includes leading Estonian bank Hansapank .
